trans-unit.source: Provides a strongly typed <xref href="System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceView"></xref> object for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource> control enables ASP.NET data-bound controls, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> controls, to bind to site map data.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class is used by controls developers but it is not used by page developers nor in page code.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource> returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> for a specified hierarchical path when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceView.Select%2A> method is called.
Like all hierarchical data source view objects, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> is not named; rather, its is identified by its unique hierarchical path.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> is a wrapper class on a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> collection.

The <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> class implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalEnumerable> interface, which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class returns from a call to `Select` method.

Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> work with <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNode> objects, the view maintains an internal <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> to contain them.
The collection is initialized using the view's constructors and accessed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method.
Initializes a new named instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView"></xref> class, adding the single specified node to the internal collection of nodes.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class is a wrapper class on a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> object.

Creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.%23ctor%2A> constructor initializes the internal node collection with a single <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNode> object.
The site map structure is navigated using the node as a point of reference.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource"></xref> that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView"></xref> is associated with.
The name of the view.
The <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapNode"></xref> to add to the internal <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection"></xref>.
Initializes a new named instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView"></xref> class, setting the internal collection of nodes to the specified node collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class is a wrapper class on a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> object.

Creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.%23ctor%2A> constructor initializes the internal node collection with the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> that is passed to the constructor.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource"></xref> that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView"></xref> is associated with.
The name of the view.
A <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection"></xref> of nodes that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView"></xref> provides a view of.
Gets the collection of the <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapNode"></xref> objects that represents the site navigation structure for the current user.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class implements the inherited <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method to retrieve a set of nodes that represents the site navigation structure for the current ASP.NET application.

Page developers and data-bound control authors do not call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method directly; instead, use the publicly exposed <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> that is used to request operations on the data beyond basic data retrieval.
A <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection"></xref> that represents the site navigation structure for the current user.

The arguments passed to the specify that the data source should perform some additional work while retrieving data to enable paging or sorting through the retrieved data, but the data source control does not support the requested capability.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.DataSourceViewChanged"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains event data.
Gets the collection of the <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapNode"></xref> objects that represents the site navigation structure for the current user.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method, passing the `arguments` parameter.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method is used by controls developers but it is not used by page developers nor in page code.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> that is used to request operations on the data beyond basic data retrieval.
A <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection"></xref> that represents the site navigation structure for the current user.

The arguments passed to the specify that the data source should perform some additional work while retrieving data to enable paging or sorting through the retrieved data, but the data source control does not support the requested capability.
